title: Sally Peabodys New Book When the Pixies Left is a Creatively Crafted and Vividly Illustrated Journey into a Life of Innocence and Guilt
text:
Recent release “When the Pixies Left” from Page Publishing author Sally Peabody is about the struggle to overcome addiction.
(PRWEB) October 23, 2015
Sally Peabody, a wife, mother, devoted writer and author, has completed her new book “When the Pixies Left”: a gripping and potent tale about losing one’s innocence and discovering self-worth.
Published by New York City-based Page Publishing, Sally Peabody’s poignant tale details the issues of addiction and aims to persuade addicts to learn to live in a world they never gave a chance to know.
The simple innocence of a young child’s imagination is a wondrous thing. They find peace and strength in what they pretend to believe in. Building homes for pixies they never see. Still this daily duty is dedicated to keeping these tiny friends safe and dry. Food and water are left each evening to ensure they never leave. But children grow, and life is full of changes. Eventually the pixies do leave. Peace slips away as life begins. Things become complicated. Innocence is lost. There are choices, many forks in the road. When you end up on the wrong path, it is cluttered and full of obstacles. When the pixies left, the road became rocky, and life became harder with each poor choice. The child is lost, and the adult who emerges scrambles to find a replacement for the peace once known.
Readers who wish to experience this inspiring work can purchase “When the Pixies Left” at bookstores everywhere or online at the Apple iTunes store, Amazon, Google Play or Barnes and Noble.
For additional information or media inquiries, contact Page Publishing at 866-315-2708.
